comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content: No T G Alder in Irish Rifles listed in MICs. In fact, it is very difficult to find any mention whatsoever of Lieut Alder. Possible attendance at the funeral of Captain Harry Garratt Whitaker of the South Lancashire Regiment in January 1920. www.prescot-rollofhonour.info/casualty-326-Harry_Whitaker...

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content:
Second Lieutenant Thomas G S Alder of 8th (Irish) Battalion, The King's (Liverpool Regiment), was appointed a Second Lieutenant in 5th Battalion, The Prince of Wales's Volunteers (South Lancashire Regiment) with effect 29th June 1915. [London Gazette 29209 of 25th June 1915].

Thomas Alder's original Commission was dated from 28th September 1914 [London Gazette 29307 of 24th September 1915].  In this photograph he appears to be wearing the uniform of 8th (Irish) Battalion, The King's (Liverpool Regiment).  He probably survived the Great War.  There is a Thomas G S Alder recorded as being married in West Derby, Lancashire, in 1922.

There is also a likely identification of this officer in the census returns for 1901 - shown as Thomas Alder, b. 1896, in Germany but a British subject, and at that time living in Toxteth, Liverpool.  There also appears to be a connection of some sort between 8 KINGS and 5 PWO, the former occasionally providing officers into the latter.//

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content:
In light of Gary's comment there is also the following:
Thomas Graham Scarisbrick Alder, otherwise Thomas Graham, of 20 Avenue l'Yser, Brussels, Belgium. Died 6 Jan 1960 at 29 Place Georges, Brugnam, Brussels. Probate granted to Marguerite Stuart Alder, widow. Value £3945.

TGS Alder married Marguerite Stuart Biram in 1922. 

In 1950 Mrs Alder was a passenger aboard the SS Washington travelling from Le Havre to Southampton. She gave her residence at the time as 95A Anglesea Road, Dublin, Ireland.

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content: SUPPLEMENT TO THE LONDON GAZETTE, 9 DECEMBER, 1914 Liverpool Institute Contingent, Junior Division, Officers Training Corps. Thomas Graham Scarisbrick Alder www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/29001/supplements/10563/p...
